intro: Caenotus longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved caenotus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, elongated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Caenotus longifolius is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
